articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Inspects Chollima Steel Complex
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Inspects Chollima Steel Complex
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Chollima Steel Complex.
					 Going round the complex and the Posan Iron Works which are waging a dynamic drive for increased iron production, the premier encouraged the officials, technicians and workers to work hard to implement the party's policy and convened a consultative meeting.
					
					 At the meeting he underscored the need for the officials and other workers of the complex to steadily increase the production capacity by stepping up Juche-orientation and modernization of the non-ferrous metal industry, with firm resolve to shatter the moves of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges to ignite a war in hearty response to the line advanced by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un on pushing forward economic construction and the building of nuclear force.
					
					 More iron and steel are required at the worksites for building a socialist economic power, the premier said, calling for making great innovations in production.
					
					 The consultative meeting took measures for the Cabinet and relevant units to substantially supply raw and other materials needed for normal production and updating of the complex.
					
					 Earlier, he made a field survey of the Sunchon Cement Complex.
					
					 After going round different places of the complex, he convened a consultative meeting. Discussed there were issues on substantially supplying cement needed for implementing the new line of the Workers' Party of Korea and stepping up the updating of production processes.
					
					 The premier also went round the construction site of the Children's Hospital and the venue of the 16th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair.

articles.title: Japanese Cabinet Official Flies Back
articles.content:
Japanese Cabinet Official Flies Back
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Isao Iijima, special counselor in charge of crisis management in Abe's Cabinet of Japan, and his companion flew back on Friday.

articles.title: Round-table Talks Held with Inhabitants upon Their Return Home from South
articles.content:
Round-table Talks Held with Inhabitants upon Their Return Home from South
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks with inhabitants of the DPRK were held at the Koryo Compatriots House on Friday upon their return home from south Korea to which they had been taken due to south Korean puppet agents' sinister plots and allurement and appeasement. 
					 They are Kang Kyong Suk, 60, who lived in Namyang Workers' District of Onsong County, North Hamgyong Province; Kim Kyong Ok, 41, who lived in Sinhung-dong No. 1 of Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province; and Ri Hyok Chol, 26, who lived in Sabong-dong of Songphyong District, Chongjin City, North Hamgyong Province. 
					
					 Kang Kyong Suk was taken to south Korea in 2010, Kim Kyong Ok in 2011 and Ri Hyok Chol in 2007. 
					
					 They brought to light the despicable plot-breeding and allurement and appeasement activities being conducted by the south Korean puppet group as part of the operations to lure and abduct inhabitants of the DPRK. 
					
					 Kim Kyong Ok recalled that she was taken to south Korea due to threat and appeasement made by Kim Kwang Chol, specialist in buying and tempting people wandering about China's border area, via "refugee camps" in Kunming, Yunnan Province of China and Thailand. 
					
					 Ri Hyok Chol said he was taken to south Korea, deceived by his elder brother Ri Sang Chol who defected to the south at the manipulation of Chon Ki Won, pastor of the "Turihana Missionary Council" in Pangbae-dong, Seoul. He said he felt disgusting towards the elder brother who took him to south Korea for a petty amount of money and seized his money. But he could not repress his bitter resentment at agents of the puppet Intelligence Service who manipulated such allurement and abduction operation, he added.
					
					 The participants in the round-table talks laid bare the sinister aims sought by the puppet group in such operations.
					
					 Kang Kyong Suk quoted a man who was in charge of her at the "Joint Center for Interrogation of Defectors from the North" in south Korea as saying: "We are trying to increase the ranks of defectors from the north, even spending so much money in order to win back even a person of the north to our side in a bid to weaken the forces of the Workers' Party of the north and bring them to collapse and hoist our flag there."
					
					 Kim Kyong Ok also quoted a man who was questioning her as saying: "We keep bringing people like you to the south not because money is in surplus. It is aimed to disturb the mindset of the north and spread liberal democracy to it".
					
					 The speakers described south Korea as the worst tundra of human rights, adding that they were exposed to harsh persecution and disgrace. They condemned the south Korean puppet group for its moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet group is resorting to the smear campaign against the DPRK, trumpeting about the "human rights record" in the north, Kang Kyong Suk noted, and went on:
					
					 The group set up even a TV channel specializing in conducting an anti-DPRK smear campaign, letting "defectors from the north" appear in programs.
					
					 It went the lengths of bringing together those "who were not defectors from the north" and staging such burlesque as an art performance by a "group of beautiful girls, defectors from the north," in the heart of Seoul as part of the smear campaign against the north. 
					
					 Kim Kyong Ok noted that the puppet group is distributing money to wicked elements who fled to the south after committing crimes in the DPRK, before driving them to the anti-DPRK human rights campaign.
					
					 Ri Hyok Chol bitterly denounced a representative of the "Federation of Movement for Free North Korea" in south Korea for his sheer fabrication and groundless vituperation. This guy claimed in a television news briefing program that the people of north Korea were forced to weep along the route during the ceremony of bidding the last farewell to leader Kim Jong Il in December 2011 and otherwise they were threatened with arrest.
					
					 The participants in the round-table talks said they keenly realized once again that the DPRK is a large flower garden prevalent with humanity and it represents the genuine bosom of a mother. They pledged to turn over a new leaf and dedicate themselves to the drive for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: National Calligraphic Festival Closes
articles.content:
National Calligraphic Festival Closes
Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- A national calligraphic festival celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was closed with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International Cinema House on Friday.
					  On display there were more than 300 calligraphic works including "Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" and "Bliss".
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, creators, fans, Pyongyangites, school youth and students and children.
					
					 Medal, diplomas and certificates of the festival were awarded to the participants who displayed successful works.

articles.title: KCNA on Gun-related Crimes and Future of US
articles.content:
KCNA on Gun-related Crimes and Future of US
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, there happened in Florida State a horrible gun-related crime at a time when the U.S. is at a loss what measures should be taken to bring gun-related crimes under control.
					 A three-year child killed himself by firing a pistol he took from a bag of his uncle.
					
					 The child was immediately taken to a hospital by his parents but he breathed his last.
					
					 The child's death seems to foretell a tragic fate of the U.S., a hub of violence culture such as gun-related crimes.
					
					 According to information released by the U.S. magazine Foreign Policy, gun-related violence leaves more than 30,000 people dead and over 200,000 wounded in the U.S. every year.
					
					  This means that more than one person falls victim to this violence every two minutes.
					
					 The U.S. administration claims to have taken steps to prevent it but their prospect remains gloomy.
					
					  On January 16, the U.S. president made public a proposal for gun control the keynote of which is to ban the use of assault weapons and make an inquiry into all buyers of guns, etc.
					
					 However, this proposal has, in fact, been put on the verge of becoming null and void due to the U.S. Gun Association which rakes up a huge amount of money through gun production and sale. It put pressure upon senators from ruling and opposition parties in the run-up to the 2014 mid-term election, showing off purses.
					
					 In the final analysis, the proposal failed to reach U.S. Congress on April 17.
					
					 The bottom line of gun-related crimes rife in the U.S. is the law of the jungle and extreme misanthropy, the almighty dollar principle and individualism.
					
					 Hundreds of millions of guns possessed by Americans are charged with misanthropy. Gun report sounded in every crime is reminiscent of a shout "I can live only when I kill you" often heard from among Americans.
					
					 The U.S.-style "freedom" and "democracy" reduced human beings to brutes and produced Article 2 of the revived Constitution which recognized the right to possession of guns, giving spurs to the sale of guns and horrible gun-related crimes.
					
					 It is a matter of time that the whole of U.S. society will turn into a scene of gunfight.
					
					 Owing to the corrupt ideology and culture prevalent throughout the society, U.S.-style capitalism is bound to meet self-destruction. This is the future of the U.S.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Trip to US Dismissed as Sycophantic
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Trip to US Dismissed as Sycophantic
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations of south Korea including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification held the 164th action for independent reunification and peace on May 14.
					 Speakers at the meeting accused the present chief executive of crying out for "sanctions" and pressure on the north and the "change in the north" during her junket to the U.S., and thus dashing the hope of the nation for independence and the peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Her visit to the U.S. was just aimed to confirm the hostile policy toward fellow countrymen and the military nexus with the U.S. and Japan, they deplored.
					
					 Ridiculing the sexual scandal committed by a Chongwadae spokesman as the fruit of the trip, they charged that sycophancy is what she has done in the U.S.
					
					 The situation shows that the reunification of the Korean Peninsula should be achieved by the nation's concerted efforts, they said, calling on all Koreans to block the south Korea-U.S. alliance for aggression and achieve the peaceful reunification with their own efforts.

articles.title: Japanese Right-wing Forces' Absurd Assertion Slammed
articles.content:
Japanese Right-wing Forces' Absurd Assertion Slammed
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Hangyore, Kyunghyang Daily News and Hankuk Ilbo of south Korea on May 13 carried articles denouncing the Japanese right-wing forces for their assertion of justifying the hideous crimes against humanity committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past. 
					 The articles said:
					
					 The mayor of Osaka City of Japan defended the system of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army by deflecting the responsibility for sexual slavery crimes on the war. He said "comfort women were needed at that time".
					
					 The mayor even denied the coercive nature of the sexual slavery with such rhetoric that "it has not been confirmed that abduction was made by way of violence and threats". He made no scruple of saying that "it should be asserted that Japan has unreasonably been insulted because of charges quite contrary to fact". 
					
					 Critical voices are rising within Japan in fear of the right-wing forces' remarks going out of control. They are asserting that sexual slavery system was not necessary and that they have no qualifications to make remarks humbling human being and discuss state administration.

articles.title: Chongryon Official Denounces S. Korean Chief Executive's Junket to US
articles.content:
Chongryon Official Denounces S. Korean Chief Executive's Junket to US
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Pae Ik Ju, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), Wednesday made public a statement denouncing the south Korean chief executive's junket to the U.S.
					 Her visit to the U.S. was a traitorous one as she gained the U.S. approval of the anti-reunification confrontation policy and promised to join the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, the statement said, and went on: 
					
					 The reality fully proves that the present chief executive came to power by alluring south Korean people with the outcries for "distinction" and "change", but she is the same with traitor Lee Myung Bak who drove the inter-Korean relations into the worst catastrophe. 
					
					 She should make a correct option, bearing in mind that tie-ups with the U.S. and confrontation with fellow countrymen will get her nowhere.

articles.title: Investigation into Sexual Scandal Urged
articles.content:
Investigation into Sexual Scandal Urged
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- An overseas Koreans organization in the U.S. released a statement on May 13 to demand the thorough-going investigation into the sexual scandal by the south Korean puppet group.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The sexual scandal that occurred during the south Korean chief executive's visit to the U.S. was a disgraceful act which made the Koreans in the U.S. hard to raise their heads.
					
					 The senior officials of Chongwadae rapidly let the criminal flee to south Korea, the statement said, adding this is also a grave crime as it helped the escape.
					
					 It urged the south Korean chief executive and the "National Assembly" to directly come out to thoroughly investigate the case to reveal the truth and take a measure for punishment.
					
					 It vowed to struggle till the demands of the Koreans in the U.S. are met.

articles.title: Lecture on Situation on Korean Peninsula Given in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Lecture on Situation on Korean Peninsula Given in Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- A lecture on the situation on the Korean Peninsula was given in Mlada Boleslav County, the Czech Republic on May 9.
					 Present there were officials of the Communist Party of Czech and Moravia and the Czech, Moravian, Silesian Trade Unions' Association and masses.
					
					 Introduced at the lecture were unreasonableness and danger of the U.S. hostile policy and nuclear threat to the DPRK which are the root cause of the tension on the peninsula, and the just stand and resolute measures for self-defense taken by the DPRK to cope with them.
					
					 The chairman of the C.C., the Association said the lecture offered him an opportunity to clearly know who is to blame at the escalating tension on the peninsula.
					
					 The chairman of the Mlada Boleslav County Committee of the Communist Party said the DPRK could firmly safeguard socialism as they had achieved unity and cohesion of the leader, the party and the masses and bolstered military capacity.
					
					 The Korean people will surely emerge victorious in the efforts to build socialism and protect the country's sovereignty under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, he added.

articles.title: Peruvian Figure Censures US Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Peruvian Figure Censures US Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The secretary general of the Transport Workers Union of Peru made public a statement on May 8 in protest against the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 He referred to the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises staged by the U.S. forces and south Korean puppet army from March 1 to April 30.
					
					 The DPRK headed by the dear respected Kim Jong Un took self-defensive measures, considering the military drills as nuclear war drills aimed to severely threaten its sovereignty, he said.
					
					 The U.S. is trying to put south Korea under its military control and stamp out all progressive forces, he said.
					
					 He resolutely condemned the war policy of the U.S. imperialists against the DPRK. He called upon the world public to join in the struggle against the U.S. moves for invading the DPRK.

articles.title: US Forced DPRK to Have Access to Nukes: Brazilian Paper
articles.content:
US Forced DPRK to Have Access to Nukes: Brazilian Paper
 Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian paper Hora do Povo on May 8 carried a commentary titled "It is U.S. which compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons".
					 The U.S. is accusing the DPRK of having access to nukes, asserting that the DPRK's possession of nukes should not be tolerated, the commentary said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. has become vocal about the DPRK's access to nukes, in disregard of the essence of the issue of the Korean Peninsula. The DPRK brought into bolder relief the U.S. aim to cover up its true colors as a nuclear criminal and carry out its plan for invading the DPRK.
					
					 If the U.S. had not threatened the DPRK with nuclear weapons and had not tried to deprive it of its sovereignty, it would have focused its efforts on improving the standard of people's living and building an economic power.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nukes is a step for self-defence and a just act to protect its sovereignty in the face of the U.S. escalating moves for a nuclear war.
					
					 The U.S. has posed ceaseless nuclear threats to the DPRK, pursuing the hostile policy toward it for decades.
					
					 It is a foolish act for one to counter with empty fists those who come in attack with sword and to counter with stick those who threaten with nuclear weapons.
					
					 In order to defend the sovereignty of the country and guarantee the life and security of the people from the escalating U.S. nuclear threats, the DPRK was compelled to have access to nuclear weapons.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. which forced the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige la Fabrica 20 de Febrero del EPC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige la Fabrica 20 de Febrero del EPC
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno la Fabrica 20 de Febrero del EPC.
					La fabrica con una superficie util de 109 mil metros cuadrados es una base combinada capaz de elaborar simultaneamente diversos alimentos como salsa y pasta de soya, polvo aperitivo, aceite, mantequilla, confites, etc. y los cereales.
					
					Luego de escuchar explicaciones de los letreros de instrucciones dadas sobre el terreno por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, construidos a la entrada de la fabrica, el Mariscal recorrio las salas de educacion en historia revolucionaria y de presentacion del historial.
					
					Dijo que en esta fabrica estan registradas muchas hazanas de direccion del Presidente y el Dirigente y evaluo altamente los exitos alcanzados anteriormente por los militantes del partido y otros trabajadores de ella.
					
					Averiguo en detalles el estado de produccion recorriendo varios puntos como el taller de polvo aperitivo, los no.1 y no.2 de alimentos basicos, el de mantequilla, el de arroz precocido para la cocina instantanea, el de elaboracion combinada y la sala de exhibicion de articulos.
					
					Ante el plano de los procesos de produccion de los talleres, el Comandante Supremo escucho explicaciones y pregunto sobre las especificaciones tecnicas y la capacidad productiva de cada equipo.
					
					Pregunto como es la proporcion de mezcla de materias primas para la produccion de alimentos basicos y como transcurre el proceso de fermentacion, si es normal el colorido de salsa y pasta de soya y el grado de pulverizacion de polvo aperitivo y como se empaquetan los productos.
					
					En el taller de mantequilla pregunto cuales son las materias primas y en el de arroz precocido para la cocina instantanea, examino la calidad de arroz precocido y cuales son los alimentos subsidiarios que acompanan el arroz a consumir por los militares.
					
					En el taller de elaboracion combinada, probo una galleta prensada e hizo conocimiento de la cantidad de carne para la lata y el metodo de su medicion.
					
					Paseando por el recinto de la fabrica, vio los altos arboles de diversas especies inclusive metasequoia glyptostroboides que forman un bosque y dijo que le parece ver un parque y en la fabrica esta bien establecida la cultura de produccion y vida.
					
					Recorriendo el comedor de la fabrica, se informo de como marchan las labores de abastecimiento para los obreros.
					
					Senalo que la tarea mas importante que se presenta ante la fabrica es modernizar los equipos y realizar la automatizacion completa de los procesos a la altura del nuevo siglo y agrego que asi pueden normalizar en alto grado la produccion, ahorrar la mano de obra y garantizar la seguridad higienica de los alimentos.
					
					Dijo que los funcionarios deben trazar bien la estrategia empresarial y administrativa y mejorar sin cesar el metodo de gestion, de modo que se disponga de suficientes materias primas.
					
					Resalto la necesidad de mejorar el nivel tecnico y la responsabilidad de los productores para garantizar la calidad de alimentos elaborados.
					
					Al final, tomo una foto de recuerdo con los obreros de la fabrica.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta visita el jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, y el primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Jon Chang Bok.

articles.title: Premier coreano averigua labores de Complejo de Acero Chollima
articles.content:
Premier coreano averigua labores de Complejo de Acero Chollima
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno las labores del Complejo de Acero Chollima.
					En varios puntos del Complejo y la Fundicion de Hierro de Posan el premier estimulo a los funcionarios, tecnicos y obreros que se entregan a cumplir la politica del partido y convoco la reunion de consulta.
					
					En la ocasion, Pak subrayo que en acato a la linea del desarrollo paralelo de la construccion economica y la de las fuerzas armas nucleares presentada por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un, los funcionarios y obreros del Complejo deben acelerar la jucheanizacion y la modernizacion de la industria metalurgica ferrosa y mejorar sin cesar la capacidad productiva con el deseo de frustrar las maniobras belicas del imperialismo norteamericano y sus lacayos.
					
					Senalo que los campos de la construccion de la potencia economica socialista exigen muchos materiales de hierro y acero y se refirio a la necesidad de avivar mas el fervor de innovaciones en la produccion.
					
					Tomo las medidas para que el Consejo de Ministros y las unidades relacionadas suministren satisfactoriamente las materias primas y los materiales necesarios a la normalizacion de la produccion y modernizacion del Complejo.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier estuvo en el Complejo de Cemento de Sunchon.
					
					Terminada la recorrida por varios lugares del Complejo, organizo una reunion consulta, ocasion en la cual fue debatido el asunto de suministrar con satisfaccion el cemento necesario al cumplimiento de la nueva linea del desarrollo paralelo del partido y acelerar la modernizacion de los procesos de produccion.
					
					Ademas, el premier paso revista al campo de construccion de un hospital infantil y la sede de la XVI Exposicion Internacional de Mercancias Primaveral de Pyongyang.

articles.title: Parten de regreso Isao Iijima y su comitiva
articles.content:
Parten de regreso Isao Iijima y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ACNC) -- Partieron de esta capital el dia 17 Isao Iijima, consejero especial encargado del manejo de crisis en el gabinete japones de Abe, y su comitiva.

articles.title: Tiene lugar mesa redonda con habitantes que volvieron a la RPDC
articles.content:
Tiene lugar mesa redonda con habitantes que volvieron a la RPDC
Pyongyang, 17 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este viernes en la capitalina Casa de Compatriotas Coryo la mesa redonda con los habitantes que regresaron a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea desde el territorio surcoreano adonde se habian ido siendo enganados y seducidos por los titeres surcoreanos.
					 En la ocasion estuvieron presentes Kang Kyong Suk (60 anos de edad), Kim Kyong Ok (41 anos de edad) y Ri Hyok Chol (26 anos de edad) quienes vivian en el poblado obrero Namyang del distrito de Onsong de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, el barrio Sinhung 1 de la ciudad de Sariwon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte y el barrio Sabong del municipio de Songphyong de la ciudad de Chongjin de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte, respectivamente.
					
					 Ellos se trasladaron al Sur de Corea en 2010, 2011 y 2007, respectivamente.
					
					  Sobre todo, denunciaron la sucia y persistente operacion de la banda de los titeres surcoreanos para seducir y secuestrar a los habitantes norcoreanos.
					
					  Kim Kyong Ok dijo que rendida ante la amenaza de Kim Kwang Chol, quien se dedica al soborno y seduccion a los norcoreanos deambulando por las zonas fronterizas, fue al Sur de Corea luego de pasar algun tiempo en los "reclusorios de refugiados" en Kunming de la provincia de Yunnan de China y Tailandia, 
					
					  Ri Hyok Chol comento que se fue al Sur de Corea siendo enganado por su hermano mayor Ri Sang Chol que se ha fugado para alla bajo la instigacion de Chon Ki Won, pastor del "Consejo de Misioneros Turihana" situada en el Pangbae-dong de Seul.
					
					  Se mostro indignado ante la conducta mezquina de su hermano que sedujo a su propio hermano menor para ganar una suma miserable de dinero.
					
					Se monto en colera tambien por la sucia operacion de los agentes del Servicio de Inteligencia del Sur de Corea que controlan y fomentan el rapto detras de la cortina.
					
					  Los participantes en la mesa redonda expusieron el intento malsano con que los titeres surcoreanos llevan al Sur de Corea a los habitantes de la RPDC.
					
					  Segun confeso Kang Kyong Suk, un sujeto, que interrogo a ella en el "Centro Conjunto de Interrogacion de los Fugitivos Norcoreanos", le dijo asi sin escrupulos: "Estamos gastando mucho dinero para aumentar el numero de fugitivos norcoreanos. Promovemos el paso a nuestro lado de mas habitantes norcoreanos para que se debilite y se derrumbe el campo del Partido del Trabajo del Norte de Corea. Asi podremos colocar ahi nuestra bandera".
					
					Kim Kyong Ok revelo que su inquisidor le dijo que "secuestramos a ustedes no por el exceso de dinero, sino para confundir a la poblacion norcoreana y propagar la democracia liberal en el Norte de Corea". 
					
					El suelo surcoreano es el peor infierno de DDHH del mundo, dijeron los oradores y se refirieron a los maltratos e injurias sufridos y denunciaron las maniobras conflictivas anti-RPDC de los titeres surcoreanos. 
					
					Kang Kyong Suk subrayo que los titeres surcoreanos recurren a la campana intrigante anti-RPDC cuestionando la situacion de "DDHH" de alguien. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos establecieron hasta un canal de TV que se entrega a calumniar a la RPDC bajo la presencia de los "fugitivos norcoreanos". 
					
					Y lanzan hasta a los tipejos que no son "fugitivos norcoreanos" a librar en las calles de Seul las actividades artisticas del "grupo de guapas norcoreanas" de calumnia a la RPDC. 
					
					Kim Kyong Ok tambien dijo que los titeres instigan a los fugitivos delincuentes norcoreanos a la campana intrigante de DDHH anti-RPDC ofreciendoles hasta el dinero.
					
					Segun Ri Hyok Chol, el llamado delegado de la "Federacion de Movimiento por el Norte Libre" maldijo ante TV que en el acto de despedida al Dirigente Kim Jong Il, realizada solemnemente en diciembre de 2011, el Norte de Corea obligo a los habitantes a derramar las lagrimas acosandoles si no lo hicieran irian al carcel. 
					
					Los participantes dijeron que pudieron conocer bien que la RPDC es la sociedad humanocentrica y verdadero regazo de madre y expusieron la decision de hacer una nueva partida y dedicar lo todo por la prosperidad de la patria.
